benchmark_details.name: A multi-level multi-label text classification dataset of 19th century Ottoman and Russian literary and critical texts
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a multi-level, multi-label text classification dataset comprising over 3000 documents featuring literary and critical texts from 19th-century Ottoman Turkish and Russian. It is the first study to apply large language models (LLMs) to this dataset sourced from prominent literary periodicals of the era.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The dataset is expected to be a valuable resource for researchers in natural language processing and machine learning, especially for historical and low-resource languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The data collection process requires experts and significant human effort.

data.source: Over 3000 documents sourced from prominent literary periodicals from the 1830s to the 1910s.
data.annotation: Annotated by human experts based on a taxonomic framework considering structural and semantic attributes.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model performance on classification tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Measured performance in terms of accuracy and F1 scores across different classification models.
methodology.baseline_results: Model performances reported for Llama-2, Falcon, mBERT, and Bag-of-Words naive Bayes model.
methodology.validation: The dataset and the models were validated through several classification tasks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Expert review of the articles ensures consideration of diverse cultural contexts.
